graph_title: Completion rate of primary and lower secondary education
indicator_available: Completion rate of primary and lower secondary education
indicator_name: Completion rate (primary education, lower secondary education, upper secondary education)
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 4: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 4.1: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 4.1.2: Completion rate (primary education, lower secondary education, upper secondary education)
STAT_CONC_DEF__GLOBAL: Primary and lower secondary education completion rate is measured as the gross intake ratio to the last grade of lower primary/secondary education. It is calculated as the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary/lower secondary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary/lower secondary education.
REC_USE_LIM__GLOBAL:
There are many reasons why the primary and lower secondary completion rate can exceed 100 percent - the numerator may include late entrants and overage children who have repeated one or more grades of primary education as well as children who entered school early, while the denominator is the number of children at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education.

This indicator is being used as an approximation of the UN SDG Indicator. Where possible, we will work to identify or develop UK data to meet the global indicator specification. This indicator has been identified in collaboration with topic experts.
SDG_GOAL: Goal 4: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
SDG_TARGET: Target 4.1: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 4.1.2: Completion rate (primary education, lower secondary education, upper secondary education)
CONTACT_ORGANISATION: UNESCO Institute for Statistics and The World Bank
STAT_CONC_DEF: Primary and lower secondary education completion rate is measured as the gross intake ratio to the last grade of lower primary/secondary education. It is calculated as the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary/lower secondary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary/lower secondary education.
SOURCE_TYPE: Primary completion rate, Lower secondary completion rate
DATA_SOURCE: UNESCO Institute for Statistics and The World Bank
REC_USE_LIM:
Due to disaggregation not available at the local level, this data represents the whole of the United Kingdom of England as opposed to Liverpool. Since data is around 100%, this has been extrapolated to assume that Liverpool's data will be similar.

There are many reasons why the primary and lower secondary completion rate can exceed 100 percent - the numerator may include late entrants and overage children who have repeated one or more grades of primary education as well as children who entered school early, while the denominator is the number of children at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education.

This indicator is being used as an approximation of the UN SDG Indicator. Where possible, we will work to identify or develop UK data to meet the global indicator specification. This indicator has been identified in collaboration with topic experts.
